required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bingocize: A Novel Mobile Application for Older Adult Health
clinical_study.official_title: Bingocize: A Novel Mobile Application to Help Maintain or Improve Older Adults' Health, Function, and Cognition

brief_summary.textblock: This study tests the effectiveness of using a new mobile application (BingocizeÂ®) to improve older adults' (a) adherence to an engaging exercise program, and (b) aspects of functional performance, health knowledge, dietary habits, and cognition.

detailed_description.textblock: Health-promoting interventions designed to improve physical and mental fitness can help reduce health care costs; they can also help maintain, or even improve, older adults' quality of life. However, getting older adults to adhere to health-promoting exercise interventions remains difficult because such programs are often perceived as being time-consuming, painful, or unenjoyable. The present study's objective is to investigate the effectiveness of a novel technological exercise intervention program for older adults (Bingocize); in doing so, the program has the potential to improve older adults' independence and quality of life. Older adults will participate in a pre/post-intervention design with random assignment to either the experimental or one of three comparison/control groups; each group will play Bingocize in a social setting with other older adults. Participants in the experimental group will use the app to engage in twice-weekly Bingocize sessions for twelve weeks (i.e., Bingo+Exercise+Health Education); control groups will also use the app for twelve weeks but for either health education-only, exercise-only, or bingo-only.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: In each wave of the study (14 weeks per wave), participant groups are randomly assigned to one of four conditions (A,B,C,D). Condition A receives exercise + health education. Condition B receives exercise only. Condition C receives health education only. Condition D receives nothing.
study_design_info.masking_description: Staff collecting pre- and post-intervention data are masked to participant condition.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in Executive Function - Inhibition Measure 1
Changes in Executive Function - Inhibition Measure 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Knowledge of Fall Risks and Proper Diet/Nutrition
secondary_outcome.description: Multiple-choice questions covering: recognition of health terms, weight management, proper diet, bone health, environmental fall risks, careful movement

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in upper body muscular strength

secondary_outcome.description: Self-report scale assessing confidence in activities that may be perceived as having risk for falling
Dietary Screener Questionnaire (DSQ) assessing nutritional intake over past 30 days
CDC Health related quality of life measure

arm_group.description: Socially-Based Exercise Intervention for Older Adults. Participants use the Bingocize app incorporating exercises AND health information on fall risks + diet/nutrition.
Socially-Based Exercise Intervention for Older Adults. Participants use the Bingocize app incorporating exercises ONLY.
Socially-Based Exercise Intervention for Older Adults. Participants use the Bingocize app incorporating health information on fall risks + diet/nutrition ONLY.
Participants use the Bingocize app to play bingo only.

intervention.intervention_name: Socially-Based Exercise Intervention for Older Adults
intervention.description: A socially-based app that incorporates exercise and/or health education into a format familiar and engaging to older adults, designed to improve adherence to health-promoting behaviors

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal or corrected normal vision
- Mobility (i.e., not wheelchair bound)
- English is native language
- Minimum physical standards (e.g., ability to walk at least 10 meters)
- No structured physical activity programs >150 minutes/week in last 6 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe neurological impairments (e.g., Parkinson's)
- Colorblindness
- Dementia

overall_official.affiliation: Western Kentucky University and Center for Applied Science in Health and Aging
Western Kentucky University and Center for Applied Science in Health and Aging

link.description: Link to Center for Applied Science in Health & Aging

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified individual participant data for all primary and secondary outcome measures will be made available.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available within 6 months after publication, and will remain available for a period of at least 3 years following completion of the clinical trial.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Investigators whose proposed use of the data has been approved by the Principal Investigators of the clinical trial.
